Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of people fired since the secretary took office by including probationary terminations.
Understate: The claim understates the number of people fired directly because of the wait-time manipulation scandal by only mentioning 60.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough specific evidence or data to support the numbers mentioned.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all 900 terminated employees were directly related to the wait-time manipulation scandal, which may not be accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative reasons for the terminations, such as poor performance or absenteeism.
